pageContext.claim: “So, we're paying a price based on the price that other nations are paying. That's what we're going to pay. No longer seven times more. No longer 10 times, 11 times, even 12 times more -- I've seen examples of paying the same price. I'm talking about billions and billions of savings to people. To people.”
pageContext.analysis: American drugs are often cheaper in countries that have socialized medicine as the drug companies negotiate directly with the government and have weaker intellectual property laws that allow them to more easily make generic varieties. But Trump's plan would not apply to over the counter prescriptions — only to medication administered in a doctor’s office, and pharmaceutical companies are already pushing back. Plus, while estimates show prices would go down, Trump’s plan would need to be approved, and is only a pilot program and would not immediately impact the whole country.
